Recruitment.Description: The Applied Behavioral Economics lab is a clinical- and research-oriented program that prepares students to be capable behavioral scientists and clinical practitioners. Students from the lab are trained in both behavior analysis and clinical psychology and will be eligible for licensure as both behavior analysts and psychologists.
Recruitment.Topics: Translational methods in operant behavioral economics, individual and caregiver choice in behavioral treatment, clinical practice in and outside of developmental disabilities, implications of diversity and bias in applied behavior analysis

Openings.Supervisor: This is a mock area head
